title: Job Woes Linger in 29 States as U.S. Recovers Unevenly
summary:
Nevada, Arizona and Florida are among those furthest from their peak employment during the December 2007-June 2009 downturn.
Nevada, Arizona and Florida are among those furthest from their peak employment during... Read More Nevada, Arizona and Florida are among those furthest from their peak employment during the December 2007-June 2009 downturn.
Nevada, Arizona and Florida are among those furthest from their peak employment during the December 2007-June 2009 downturn.
While housing prices have regained part of their losses, Nevada was 5.9 percent below its peak employment, Arizona 4.1 percent, Florida 1.5 percent and Georgia 1.1 percent.
He worked in a variety of manufacturing and construction jobs before the recession.
meta_description: Kevin Yearout has added about 80 jobs to his Albuquerque, New Mexico, contracting company since July of last year. That still leaves him with less than half the number he employed in 2009, at the end of the deepest downturn since the Great Depression.
